benchmark_details.name: Japanese Legal Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: We introduce a high-quality, native Japanese legal dataset specifically designed for legal text retrieval, developed manually to preserve essential cultural and linguistic nuances.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve retrieval performance for Japanese legal texts through a specialized dataset and a novel two-phase retrieval pipeline.

data.source: The dataset was generated using Gemini 1.5 Pro and includes manually verified legal articles and employment contract documents.
data.size: 3,259 rows of training data, 73 rows of validation data, 130 rows of test data
data.annotation: Manual verification and labeling of legal articles was performed to ensure accuracy.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the ranking of retrieved documents against true relevant documents.
methodology.interpretation: Higher recall and ranking metrics indicate better retrieval performance.
methodology.baseline_results: Competing models include TF-IDF, BM25+, and various neural retrieval models.
methodology.validation: The dataset is validated through comparisons with state-of-the-art retrieval methods.
